intro: Psychotria simiarum subsp. chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in southern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The species is noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though its ecological and medicinal significance remains under study.
